div.l: But I am old me lyst not pleye for age
Gras tyme is doon my foder is now forage
Thys whyte top wrytyth my old yeris
Myn hert also moulid as myn heer is
But yet I fare as doth an open ers
For that ylke fruyt is euer lenger the wers
Tyl it be rotyn in mullok or in stre
We olde men I drede so faren we
Tyl we be rotyn can we not be rype
We hoppyn alwey while the world wold pype
For in our wyl ther stykyth euer a nayl
To haue an hoore heed and a grene tayl
As hath a leek for though our myght be gon
Our wyl desiryth foly euer in one
For whaÌ„n we may nought do than wol we speken
Yet in our asshen old fyre is rekyn
Four gledis haue we whyche I shal deuyse
Auauntyng lyynge anger and couetyse
Thyse four sparkelis longyth vnto eld
Our old lymys mowe we not beweld
But wyl ne shal not fayle that is soth
And yet haue I alwey a coltis toth
As many a yeer as it is passed henne
Sen that my tappe of lyf began to renne
For sikyrly whan I was born anone
Deth drewe the tappe of lyf and let it gone
And euer seth hath so the tappe ronne
Tyl that almost al empty is the tonne
The streme of lyf now droppyth on the chymbe
The sely tunge may wel rynge and chymbe
Of wretchydnesse that past is ful yore
Wyth olde folk saue dotage ther is nomore
Whan that our hoost had herd thys sermonyng
He gan to speken as lordly as a kyng
And sayd what amountith al thys wyt
What shul we speke alday of holy wryt
The deuel made a reue for to preche
Or of a sowter a shipman or a leche
